title: How to completely open your device to absolutely no privacy - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s going to be a wee bit difficult these days, with basically every browser having privacy mode (or whatever they happen to call it), and all kinds of tools to enhance privacy, as it is the norm to try & keep at least a modicum of control over one’s privacy, rather than to abandon it. You can try to approach this by e.g. setting up a computer account with only one user account that everybody shares, but that will only get you so far, because of the privacy modes & whatnot. Having said that, I would recommend having an open discussion with whoever you’re trying to go for zero privacy, because in my experience, it’s a bad idea and basically won’t work. It’s especially bad idea, if you’re having problems with your relationship and try to solve them with “complete transparency”… …but if you’re trying to set your kid’s computer up for zero privacy, that’s not good either, because kids these days need to be taught and trained from very young to guard and take care of their privacy, as the need for it will only increase as we come even more dependent and reliant on computer technology.

Three easy steps… Buy an Android device — phone, tablet, doesn’t matter. Ignore the Terms of Use and License text that comes with the device… just click okay, like everyone else does.Create a Google account, or simply log in with an existing gMail account.Download and install whatever apps interest you. Make sure not to read the license agreements, just click “I Agree”, like everyone else does.That’s it, you’re done. That device is now a HUGE window into your life. If that’s not good enough — if you’d like to blow a hole in your privacy big enough to drive a truck through — simply join Facebook and install their app. Again, make sure not to horrify yourself by reading the Terms of Service to discover what they will actually suck out of your device … simply click “I agree”.
